newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Bre-X Minerals busy.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Bre-X Minerals busy.

text.p: Troubled Canadian mining company Bre-X Minerals Ltd rose Thursday in heavy trade to highlight markets in foreign shares and American Depositary Receipts (ADRs).
Traders said ADRs were relatively quiet and trade was marked by profit-taking after Wall Street's recent strong rise.
Bre-X was up 5/32 to 2-23/32 in late-morning trade. Volume was heavy at more than 2.5 million shares, putting the company among the most active foreign stocks.

Investors are trying to work through the details of developments surrounding Bre-X's Busang gold field in Indonesia. The company's stock has been pounded in recent weeks by questions about the value of the deposit.
Dutch software company Baan Co NV rose 1-5/8 to a 12-month high of 52 after it reported first quarter earnings per share of $0.13 against $0.05 for the same period last year.
Following release of the results Morgan Stanley raised its rating on the stock to outperform from neutral.
Swedish telecom equipment company LM Ericsson rose 9/16 to 32-3/4 in light trade. The company is scheduled to release first quarter results Friday.
Among other active stocks, Singaporean software company Creative Technology Ltd fell 5/8 to 13-5/8 and Canadian resources company Abacan Resources Corp rose 1/4 to 6-1/4.
Brazilian telephone company Telebras SA rose 7/8 to 112-3/4. It was among the most-active shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
Decliners led advancers 232 to 222 among 806 ADRs. The ADR group was up 0.06 percent and volume at midday was 41 million shares.
